Package SecurityLightController

Class NewLightControllerStateMachine

java.lang.Object
SecurityLightController.NewLightControllerStateMachine
All Implemented Interfaces:
LightControllerCommandInterface
public class NewLightControllerStateMachine extends Object implements LightControllerCommandInterface
This class implements a state machine that can be used to control a security light.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface SecurityLightController.LightControllerCommandInterface

    LightControllerCommandInterface.CommandActionEnum

  • Field Details

    • observers

      private final List<LightControllerStateMachineObserverInterface> observers
      This variable holds a list of observers. Whenever a state changes, the observers are updated with the state change.

    • currentState

      private LightControllerStateMachineObserverInterface.LightState currentState
      This variable holds the current state for the state machine. Note the scope of the variable has been set to allow easier access to this variable for testing purposes without needing to use reflection.

    • intrusionDetectionSubStateVariable

      private LightControllerStateMachineObserverInterface.LightStateIntrusionDetectedStates intrusionDetectionSubStateVariable
      This variable holds the substate for the intrusion detected state. It will have a value of 1 if the lamp is on and 0 if it is off. Note that this is also available for access without the usage of reflection.

    • light

      private LightDeviceInterface light
      This variable holds a reference to the light which is to be controlled by this state machine.

    • blinkTimer

      private LightTimerInterface blinkTimer
      This variable is a reference to the timer that is to be used to control the blinking of lights. This timer is periodic in nature and will continue to fire every x ms until shutdown.for timed activities.

    • motionDetectedTimer

      private LightTimerInterface motionDetectedTimer
      This variable is a reference to the timer that is to be used for one shot activities. This timer will fire once after x ms have gone by.

  • Constructor Details

    • NewLightControllerStateMachine

      public NewLightControllerStateMachine()
      This is the default constructor, which will instantiate a new instance of this class.

  • Method Details

    • setLight

      public void setLight(LightDeviceInterface light)
      This method will set the given light that is controlled by this state machine.
      Parameters:
      light - This is the instance of the light that is to be directly controlled.

    • setBlinkTimer

      public void setBlinkTimer(LightTimerInterface blinkTimer)
      This method will set an instance of the timer that is to be used with this class.
      Parameters:
      blinkTimer - This is the timer instance.

    • setMotionDetectedTimer

      public void setMotionDetectedTimer(LightTimerInterface motionDetectedTimer)
      This method will set the instance of the timer that is to be used for motion detection.
      Parameters:
      motionDetectedTimer - This si the timer instance.

    • updateState

      private void updateState(LightControllerStateMachineObserverInterface.LightState state)
      This method will be invoked to update the observers
      Parameters:
      state - This is the new state.

    • subscribe

      public void subscribe(LightControllerStateMachineObserverInterface obs)
      Description copied from interface: LightControllerCommandInterface
      This method will allow an external observer to subscribe to state machine, receiving updates when states change.
      Specified by:
      subscribe in interface LightControllerCommandInterface
      Parameters:
      obs - This is the observer interface that is to be subscribed.

    • unsubscribe

      public void unsubscribe(LightControllerStateMachineObserverInterface obs)
      Description copied from interface: LightControllerCommandInterface
      This method will allow an external observer to unsubscribe to state machine, stopping the reception of updates when states change.
      Specified by:
      unsubscribe in interface LightControllerCommandInterface
      Parameters:
      obs - This is the observer interface that is to be unsubscribed.

    • handleExitConditions

      private void handleExitConditions(LightControllerStateMachineObserverInterface.LightState presentState)
      This method will process exit conditions based upon leaving a state.
      Parameters:
      presentState - This is the present state. It will be used to determine which exit actions to invoke.

    • handleEntryConditions

      private void handleEntryConditions(LightControllerStateMachineObserverInterface.LightState destinationState)
      This method will process entry conditions based upon entering a state.
      Parameters:
      destinationState - This is the new state. It will be used to determine which entry actions to invoke.

    • signalAction

      public void signalAction(LightControllerCommandInterface.CommandActionEnum request)
      Description copied from interface: LightControllerCommandInterface
      This method provides a mechanism for a signal to be received by the light controller. The signal will be one of the defined values provided previously.
      Specified by:
      signalAction in interface LightControllerCommandInterface
      Parameters:
      request - This is the signal that is being received. It can be one of LIGHT_SENSOR_DARKENED, LIGHT_SENSOR_LIGHTENED, MANUAL_SWITCH_ON, MANUAL_SWITCH_OFF, MOTION_DETECTED, SECURITY_ALARM_TRIPPED, ALARM_CLEARED, or LAMP_TIMER_EXPIRED. \

    • manageIntrusionDetectedState

      private void manageIntrusionDetectedState(LightControllerCommandInterface.CommandActionEnum request)
      This private method will be invoked to manage intrusion detection. In short, it will handle the blinking of the light if an intrusion is detected.
      Parameters:
      request - This is the request that comes in.
